intro: Mollinedia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Mollinedia multiflora is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
